item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Friday, March 14, 2025 at 11:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Can we communally deprecate git checkout? (32 points | 35 comments)
2. Cursor told me I should learn coding instead of asking it to generate code (64 points | 14 comments)
3. Choosing Languages (94 points | 95 comments)
4. WebAssembly from the Ground Up – learn WASM by building a compiler (43 points | 15 comments)
5. i-cant-believe-its-not-webusb: Hacking around lack of WebUSB support in Firefox (7 points | no comments)
6. What Programming Concepts do you Struggle to Grok or Use in Production? (9 points | 7 comments)
7. Curry: A Truly Integrated Functional Logic Programming Language (19 points | 2 comments)
8. fsync() after open() is an elaborate no-op (7 points | 15 comments)
9. coq-of-rust: Formal verification tool for Rust (2 points | 1 comment)
10. Xata Agent: AI agent expert in PostgreSQL (4 points | 7 comments)
11. IO devices and latency (9 points | 2 comments)
12. Something Is Rotten in the State of Cupertino (48 points | 49 comments)
13. Recursion kills: The story behind CVE-2024-8176 / Expat 2.7.0 released, includes security fixes (3 points | no comments)
14. High-performance computing, with much less code (6 points | 1 comment)
15. How to write a quine (8 points | 4 comments)
16. C plus Prolog (25 points | 7 comments)
17. It’s Not As Simple As “Use A Memory Safe Language" - YouTube (1 points | no comments)
18. It's not cheating if you write the video game solver yourself (13 points | 1 comment)
19. Typestate Programming (3 points | 2 comments)
20. What are you doing this weekend? (1 points | no comments)
21. Enhancing CA Practices: Key Updates in Mozilla Root Store Policy, v3.0 (1 points | no comments)
22. Memory Corruption in Delphi (2 points | no comments)
23. We should improve libzfs somewhat (12 points | 6 comments)
24. Carefully But Purposefully Oxidising Ubuntu (55 points | 9 comments)
25. Almquist shell (ash) variants (15 points | no comments)
